channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ​Trump’s win sparked stocks for this surprising reason — and it’s fueling the market rally
item.description: Investors hate uncertainty; the U.S. election result was quick and orderly.

item.title: Metal Prices Fall on Strong Dollar, Rising Chinese Copper Output
item.description: Metal prices fell on a strong dollar and rising Chinese refining capacity, with copper now at its lowest level since mid-September due to an unfavorab...

item.title: Fed’s Barkin says economy looks ‘pretty good,’ but labor market bears watching
item.description: “The labor market might be fine or it might continue to weaken,” Barkin said.

item.title: 11 bank stocks trading at low valuations, even after Trump bump
item.description: Bank stocks have had quite a run following Donald Trump’s election to a second term as president. But investors need to ask themselves whether or not ...

item.title: AbbVie’s disappointing schizophrenia drug trial bodes well for rival Bristol Myers, analysts say
item.description: AbbVie’s “pain” is Bristol Myers Squibb’s “gain,” says Truist Securities analyst Srikripa Devarakonda.

item.title: Treasury yields rise as Trump trade gets revived after holiday break
item.description: Yields on U.S. government debt rose Tuesday morning as traders returned from the Veterans Day holiday and clung to expectations that President-elect D...

item.title: Surging Defense Stocks Are Asia's Trump Trade
item.description: Asian defense stocks have been on fire as global military spending rises. A second Trump presidency could keep them going.

item.title: Elliott Calls for Split at Honeywell, Discloses $5 Billion Stake in Conglomerate
item.description: The activist investor said the split of the company’s aerospace and automation businesses would create separate sector leaders that could thrive opera...

item.title: U.S. Stocks Mixed as Bond Yields Rise and Bitcoin Sets Another Record
item.description: The S&P 500 and Dow rose, while the Nasdaq retreated and bond yields climbed.

item.title: Dollar Keeps Rising Supported by Yields
item.description: The dollar continued to strengthen, supported by rising Treasury yields, as investors bet Trump policies will support both growth and inflation.
